methods_proposed.name: Lagged Mean Baseline
methods_proposed.description: Uses mean of previous year's quantity as baseline prediction

methods_proposed.name: Linear Regression with Features
methods_proposed.description: Linear regression using area, production, and engineered features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_linear_regression(train_df, test_df, target_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    import numpy as np
    from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

    # Define features
    feature_cols = ['Area-2023-24', 'Production-2023-24', 'lag_1', 'rolling_mean_2']

    X_train = train_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    y_train = train_df[target_col]

    model = LinearRegression()
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)

    X_test = test_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)

    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)

methods_proposed.name: Random Forest with Feature Engineering
methods_proposed.description: Random forest using production, area, and engineered features
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
def predict_random_forest(train_df, test_df, target_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    import numpy as np
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor

    # Define features
    feature_cols = ['Area-2023-24', 'Production-2023-24', 'lag_1', 'rolling_mean_2']

    X_train = train_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    y_train = train_df[target_col]

    model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
    model.fit(X_train, y_train)

    X_test = test_df[feature_cols].fillna(0)
    predictions = model.predict(X_test)

    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
